MR2 Training Method Table (complete computations)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): MR2 Training Method Table (complete computations)
By MR2 Forever on Thursday, September 20, 2012 - 12:36 am:

Good day Ranchers! I and my Gamers group here in the Philippines are reliving the nostalgia of Monster Rancher Series and we have influenced a lot of young bloods that are interested to play these ps1/ps2 Monster Rancher games (even though the ps3,pc and 3ds games are in full swing), In response to this, I've made a complete table for training methods for my new young friends out there for them to understand the game mechanics better, in a strategical way.

PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS NOT A NEW TRAINING METHOD BUT ONLY A TABULAR GUIDE FOR THE TRAINING METHODS POSTED HERE ON THE SITE

WEEKCONDITION 1ITEM EFFECTCONDITION 2DRILL EFFECTFINAL CONDITIONTOTAL
FATIGUESTRESSFOODITEMFORMEFFECTFATIGUESTRESSDRILLFATIGUESTRESSFATIGUESTRESS[F+2s=<70]
1----------------------------
2----------------------------
3----------------------------
4----------------------------


DESCRIPTION

WEEK - the week of the month
CONDITION 1 - the condition of the monster before any actions on that week were given
ITEM EFFECT - the effect of food/items on the monster for that week
CONDITION 2 - fatigue and stress of monster after items were given
DRILL EFFECT - effect of drills on the monster
FINAL CONDITION - the condition of the monster after items and drills were delivered.

FOOD ITEM EFFECTS CAN BE FOUND ON [Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Items: List of Items and their effects]

You can also add spoil/fear column effect of items on the table. But it is not important, in my opinion, since you can easily control the style of the monster.

If you are using drugs [example: Larox}, You can add a Lifespan Loss column effect on the table, but this strategy table is for tracking the stress and fatigue values so it would not exceed to 70 to prevent Life Loss to maximize training, so take notice.

If you want to rest your monster or send it to battle or errantry, specify it on the DRILL EFFECT TABLE. You can again add Lifespan Loss column.

Battles = - 3 weeks lifespan
Errantry = - 4 weeks lifespan

Or more if injured.

I'll be adding examples later.

NOTE: THIS TABLE IS SPECIFICALLY FOR MONSTER RANCHER 2 TRAINING SYSTEM. I WILL POST A MONSTER RANCHER 4 TABULAR TRAINING GUIDE IN THE NEAR FUTURE.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, September 20, 2012 - 11:41 pm:

Your assumptions about battles and errantry are wrong. It's not a simple number of weeks +/-. Players need to calculate the special stress and fatigue numbers for those weeks and apply them to the Lifespan Index. Read all of this thread:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): FAQ: The Most Important Game Data: Lifespan: Effect of Stress and Fatigue

The old theory about battle and errantry is disproved with the real numbers.

Also, make sure players know how likes affect the effects of foods.

By MR2 Forever on Saturday, September 22, 2012 - 12:46 am:

Oh yeah, sorry. Haha. I played MR2 a long time ago and forgot about the updates.

I now do remember that errantry adds fatigue and stress per week. And battles affects fatigue,stress and lifespan depending on the monsters like/dislikes and performance.

hrmmm. wow. Need to review this stuff.
